title: Two-span continuous beam system design
description: Design a continuous two-span beam system with different cross-sections and materials for each span, optimizing for natural frequency while satisfying deflection, stress, and mass constraints.
objectives: Maximize minimum natural frequency of the combined system
Minimize total mass subject to all constraints

steps.name: select_materials_and_sections
steps.description: Choose materials and cross-section heights for each span.

constraints.height_bounds: Each span height must be within [0.15, 0.40] m

steps.name: check_serviceability_and_strength
steps.description: Compute deflections at key nodes (left support, midspan, right support) and maximum bending stresses in each span.

formulas.deflection_span_1_midspan: Use equivalent beam method or superposition
formulas.max_bending_moment_span_1: M_max_1 = w * L1^2 / 8 (approximate for uniform load)
formulas.max_bending_moment_span_2: M_max_2 = P * a * b / L2 (for point load at distance a from left)
formulas.bending_stress: sigma = M * c / I, where c = h/2 and I = b * h^3 / 12

steps.name: frequency_and_mass_evaluation
steps.description: Compute approximate natural frequencies of the combined system and total mass.

formulas.total_mass_kg: m_total = rho_1 * A_1 * L_1 + rho_2 * A_2 * L_2
formulas.equivalent_stiffness: Use simplified approach: k_eq = (k_1^-1 + k_2^-1)^-1 for series, or k_eq = k_1 + k_2 for parallel
formulas.natural_frequency_Hz: f = (1 / (2 * pi)) * sqrt(k_eq / m_eff), where m_eff is effective mass
